title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Video Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Video Archive               Video Archive       Video Series:    Remembering the Pacific: This video series presents the personal stories behind World War II's Pacific Theater. Hear American and Japanese servicemen tell their war stories from December 7, 1941 through the war and the ongoing reconciliation between the two countries. Witness the effects on the homefront as American and Japanese civilians recount the emotions of the war years and come to terms with loved ones lost, sacrifices made and recognition of civil rights. Hear about the personal importance of the memorials and the lasting impacts of the Pacific War.   Dive Through History on the USS Arizona: Watch as National Park Service divers go underwater to the USS Arizona to do research and to check on the structural integrity of the ship.   Pearl Harbor Commemorations: Watch the events that take place here at WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument every year during the week of December 7, including the National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day Commemoration ceremony.    Happenings at the Monument: Short videos of events, visitors, and more.
